articles.author: Stephen Nellis
articles.description: Apple launched a new series of iPhones that included a new titanium shell, a faster chip and improved video game playing abilities.
articles.title: Apple unveils iPhone 15 Pro with titanium case, holds line on prices

articles.author: Byron Kaye, Roushni Nair
articles.description: Australia's top court on Thursday ruled Qantas Airways (QAN.AX) broke the law by sacking 1,700 ground staff and replacing them with contractors early in the COVID-19 pandemic, reinvigorating public criticism of a company already facing multiple scandals.
articles.title: Australia High Court rules Qantas illegally fired workers in pandemic

articles.author: Reuters
articles.description: Country Garden has won approval from its creditors to extend the maturity of one more onshore bond, sources with knowledge of the matter said, as the Chinese developer battles to avoid a default amid Beijing's efforts to stabilise the crisis-hit sector.
articles.title: Country Garden gets maturity extension approval for one more onshore bond - sources

articles.author: Shadia Nasralla, Ron Bousso
articles.description: BP CEO Bernard Looney has stepped down after less than four years in office following several allegations of personal relationships with colleagues, the company said in a statement on Tuesday.
articles.title: BP CEO Looney to resign after personal relationships with colleagues

articles.author: Diane Bartz
articles.description: The United States argued on Tuesday that Google (GOOGL.O) did not play by the rules in its efforts to keep its dominance in online search, paying billions of dollars to ensure that smaller rivals never got traction.
articles.title: US lays out how Google dominated search in much-anticipated antitrust trial

articles.author: Casey Hall
articles.description: Alibaba said on Wednesday it would open its artificial intelligence model Tongyi Qianwen to the public, in a sign it has gained Chinese regulatory approval to mass-market the model.
articles.title: Alibaba opens AI model Tongyi Qianwen to the public

articles.author: David Shepardson
articles.description: Talks between the Detroit Three automakers and United Auto Workers union are nearing a Thursday night deadline to reach a deal on a new contract before a potential walkout by 146,000 U.S. autoworkers.
articles.title: US auto labor talks intensify near strike deadline

articles.author: Ayman Werfali
articles.description: About a quarter of Libya's eastern city of Derna was wiped out after dams burst in a storm, the administration in the area said on Tuesday, and the Red Cross said 10,000 people were feared to be missing across the country in floods.
articles.title: Libya floods wipe out quarter of city, 10,000 feared missing

articles.author: Hyunsu Yim
articles.description: North Korean leader Kim Jong Un has said his visit to Russia shows the "strategic importance" of the two countries' ties, state news agency KCNA reported on Wednesday ahead of an expected summit with President Vladimir Putin.
articles.title: N.Korea's Kim stresses 'strategic importance' of Russia ties ahead of Putin summit

articles.author: Reuters
articles.description: The Sevastopol Shipyard on the Crimean Peninsula was on fire on Wednesday after Ukraine launched a missile attack on the port, injuring at least 24 people, the Russia-installed governor of the city said.
articles.title: Crimean shipyard on fire after Ukraine missile attack - Russia-installed governor
